title: Gallery: Cyclist’s first Track Day of 2023 – Did our snapper catch you?
content:
Cyclist
Gallery: Cyclist’s first Track Day of 2023 – Did our snapper catch you?

Cyclist’s first Track Day of 2023 was a roaring success, with riders demoing a range of the latest and greatest road and gravel bikes at London’s Lee Valley VeloPark at the weekend.

Cyclist snapper Patrik Lundin was on hand to capture all the action on the Saturday, so keep scrolling for a huge gallery from the event, so large that it would have come with a ’56k warning’ back in 2003.

If you’re feeling some FOMO and want another chance to trial some top-spec bikes from brands including Canyon, Cannondale, Ribble, BMC, 3T, Orro, tickets are still available for the Track Day event at Castle Combe Race Circuit in Wiltshire on June 4.  

Book your Cyclist Track Day Tickets now

Full Track Tickets for the events cost just £30 (from £20 for Cyclist subscribers!), which includes:

  • Unlimited riding time
  • A coffee, plus lunch and dessert provided by The Calzone Kitchen
  • The chance to meet like-minded cyclists and members of the Cyclist editorial team
  • A Cyclist goody bag

Groups of four or more get an automatic 15% discount on Track Tickets while non-riders who want to come along have the option of a £10 Spectator Ticket that includes track-side access and a coffee.
